location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Captain Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Commodore George Barnes Brucks, Commanding the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the settlement of claims over incidents of piracy and plunder at Debaye [Dubai]. Hennell requests that, after having visited Biddah, Brucks proceed to Dubai in order to settle claims made against Shaikh Mukhtoom [Maktum] of Dubai. Hennell authorises Brucks to use ‘all the Naval means at your disposal’ in order to settle the claims.The enclosed letter to Shaikh Maktum to which Hennell refers is not enclosed in the volume.
